newsitem.title: USA: KCBT HRW wheat called one-two cents higher.
newsitem.headline: KCBT HRW wheat called one-two cents higher.

text.p: KCBT hard red winter wheat futures were called one to two cents per bushel higher on an anticipated wheat sale to Pakistan and spillover support from expected gains in CBOT soybean futures, traders said.
Results of Pakistan's tender for 500,000 tonnes of wheat were expected Tuesday morning. U.S. exporters said 225,000 to 250,000 tonnes could be U.S. wheat and the balance from Australia and Canada.
Hedge selling may limit gains in KCBT wheat, they said. Cash wheat sales increased this week ahead of expiration of 30-day free storage deals.
